activities: LuciData Inc. acts as data processor on behalf of its individual and corporate clients and/or their legal counsel ("Clients") during its provision of any of the following services: data recovery, electronic discovery, computer forensics, litigation support, and/or related consulting ("Services").  From time to time LuciData will also act as data processor on behalf of its subsidiaries to aid them in their provision of Services to clients in their respective European countries.  Personal information is collected in the EU (i) by the Client directly or by LuciData personnel at the Client's direction or (ii) sent to LuciData in the United States by the Client or a LuciData subsidiary for processing.  During its performance of Services LuciData takes direction from its Clients as to what data it is authorized to process.  LuciData clients may also provide Personal Information to LuciData via its web-sites, including signing-up for various communications and offers from LuciData or for the purpose of purchasing those products and services LuciData offers for direct purchase via its web-sites.  LuciData uses such data for the purposes of marketing, facilitating transactions and customer support.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech:
LuciData will conduct compliance audits of its relevant privacy practices to verify adherence to this Policy.  Any employee that LuciData determines is in violation of this policy will be subject to disciplinary action up to and including termination of employment.  Any questions or concerns regarding the use or disclosure of personal information should be directed to the LuciData Privacy Office at the address given below. LuciData will investigate and attempt to resolve complaints and disputes regarding use and disclosure of personal information by reference to the principles contained in this Policy.

LuciData has further committed to refer unresolved privacy complaints under the US-EU and US-Swiss Safe Harbor Principles to an independent dispute resolution mechanism, the BBB EU SAFE HARBOR, operated by the Council of Better Business Bureaus. If you do not receive timely acknowledgment of your complaint, or if your complaint is not satisfactorily addressed by LuciData, please visit the BBB EU SAFE HARBOR web site at www.bbb.org/us/safe-harbor-complaints for more information and to file a complaint.
